data.title: College of Health & Behavioral Sciences
data.meta_description: Holistic health is about more than just the body. Learn more about degrees that will prepare you to be a health professional.
data.text:
be part of an integrated opportunity to Change lives, Including your own

Regent University’s College of Health & Behavioral Sciences consists of three schools: the School of Psychology & Counseling, the School of Nursing, and the School of Allied Health. The college offers graduate and undergraduate degree programs that can be pursued online or on-campus in Virginia Beach (varies by program).

Gain the knowledge and skills you need to advance in your career in health or behavioral sciences. Your Regent degree can equip you to answer the growing demand for interdisciplinary care and holistic health that addresses the mind, body, and spirit.

As you work toward your degree, you can gain tools to help you understand health system complexities and to serve as part of an integrated system of care. A Regent education is built on a strong Christian foundation through which you can learn to distinctively integrate science and faith and wisely engage ethical concerns.

You can also be equipped to serve others with excellence whether you pursue a role in nursing, healthcare management, health information systems, psychology, licensed and pastoral counseling, human services, or gerontology.

We Know What’s Important to You:

8-week online nursing courses

Additional 8- and 15-week psychology, counseling, and healthcare course options, online and on campus

High-quality programs to help you launch your career or upgrade your credentials

Faith-based approach

Transfer-friendly credit hours for many degree programs

Financial aid available

Top military-friendly school

Specialized accreditations: CCNE, CACREP, APA

Among the first universities to deliver unified interdisciplinary degree programs through a College of Health & Behavioral Sciences

If you are called to lead and serve in the arena of health or behavioral sciences as a caregiver, counselor, medical professional, researcher, administrator, educator, or policymaker, we invite you to apply now.
